The cabin features two bucket seats upholstered in black vinyl as well as color-coordinated door panels and carpets. Amenities include a heater, a vertical push-button AM/FM radio, an analog clock, and lap seatbelts.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a 5,500-rpm redline, and auxiliary gauges for fuel level, amperage, oil pressure, and coolant temperature. The 327ci V8 is equipped with a single four-barrel carburetor and was factory rated at 300 horsepower and 360 lb-ft of torque. Service includes:

The engine stamping is shown above. The HE suffix corresponds with a 300-horsepower, 327ci V8 for use with a manual transmission.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission. A replacement dual exhaust system has been installed, and there is corrosion on the underside.

Decoding the trim tag reveals:

  • Style 67 467 – 1967 Corvette convertible
  • Body A3195 – body number
  • Trim STD – Black vinyl upholstery
  • Paint 988 – Marlboro Maroon

The removed convertible top is included in the sale as are a service manual, photos, and a selection of spares.
